title: ICE "raw ptr comparison should already be caught in the trait system"

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-const-fn
labels.description: Area: const fn foo(..) {..}. Pure functions which can be applied at compile time.

body:
### Code ```Rust #![feature(raw_ref_op)] const RCZ: *const i32 = &raw const *&0; const fn f() { if let RCZ = &raw const *&0 { } } fn main() {} ``` ### Error output internal compiler error: [compiler/rustc_const_eval/src/transform/check_consts/ops.rs:611](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/1eb62b1235fd77200e6bd967d70e83c0f2497233/compiler/rustc_const_eval/src/transform/check_consts/ops.rs#L611): raw ptr comparison should already be caught in the trait system
Full output including backtrace

``` error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_const_eval/src/transform/check_consts/ops.rs:611:9: raw ptr comparison should already be caught in the trait system --> rps.rs:6:12 | 6 | if let RCZ = &raw const *&0 { } | ^^^ thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/1eb62b1235fd77200e6bd967d70e83c0f2497233/compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:972:33 stack backtrace: 0: 0x10f2f22a6 - >::set::, rustc_driver[c6bc39476a4ff69]::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core[e7c8723dd1d9fd02]::result::Result<(), rustc_errors[5974999511236221]::ErrorGuaranteed>> 41: 0x11f09dffa - std[e853a6d0ec043b70]::sys_common::backtrace::__rust_begin_short_backtrace::, rustc_driver[c6bc39476a4ff69]::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core[e7c8723dd1d9fd02]::result::Result<(), rustc_errors[5974999511236221]::ErrorGuaranteed>>::{closure#0}::{closure#0}, core[e7c8723dd1d9fd02]::result::Result<(), rustc_errors[5974999511236221]::ErrorGuaranteed>> 42: 0x11f07e2a5 - std::sys::unix::thread::Thread::new::thread_start::hb253bfeab5e611e1 44: 0x7ff807a764e1 - __pthread_start note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.67.0-nightly (1eb62b123 2022-11-27) running on x86_64-apple-darwin query stack during panic: #0 [mir_const_qualif] const checking `f` #1 [mir_promoted] processing MIR for `f` #2 [mir_borrowck] borrow-checking `f` #3 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack error: aborting due to previous error ```

### Regression Regression in nightly-2022-07-28, somewhere in rollup 2a220937c283803bfd5d1155e4a81e6287089504 Very likely due to #99704, which added this assertion (@fee1-dead, @oli-obk) ### Version ``` rustc 1.67.0-nightly (1eb62b123 2022-11-27) binary: rustc commit-hash: 1eb62b1235fd77200e6bd967d70e83c0f2497233 commit-date: 2022-11-27 host: x86_64-apple-darwin release: 1.67.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.4 ```
